tags: because this ask broke me in worst/best possible way and I had to headcanon my way out of it
summary: Imagine if in Avengers 4, when everyone is being brought back from the dead, Stephen just looks over everyone else reuniting and...
question: Imagine if in Avengers 4, when everyone is being brought back from the dead, Stephen just looks over everyone else reuniting and quietly portals back to the Sanctum alone. I just had this thought today and the idea of it being true is seeming uncomfortably likely.
answer:
Okay, a few minutes after the first one this one came in so they get answered together:

Anon, I hate you. No I don’t, really, but why must you hurt me so? Is it something I wrote? But I, at least, always dump Stephen into Tony’s arms after I’ve broken him. Tony can and will fix him. Why won’t you imagine the same thing? Why all this sadness and sorrow? That’s so cruel!

I can totally see this. Right down to Stephen’s facial expression and the dramatic swirl when the turns around to slink off for a little bit of self-hate in solitude. And that’s what’s hurting me so deeply right now. It’ll probably happen like this. 💔 So, lets make it better, okay?

Tony (because, yes, he survives, too, damn it!) is overjoyed to greet the returned Peter but after a moment he realizes that there’s still someone missing. He turns around, expecting to see the grave face of the wizard, who might be inclined to crack a smile now, just to see the last bit of red disappearing through a portal.

He doesn’t want to believe it and searches everywhere around him but he just can’t find Stephen. Tony had a lot of time to think in the last few months/years and he researched this Doctor Stephen Strange. He got to know Wong better. Somewhere along the road “Strange” became “Stephen” in his mind and he no longer wants to strangle the guy for putting him through hell; he wants to get to know him and look him in the eye. He wants to really see the man who put all his faith in the fuck-up and honestly expected Tony Stark to be able to fix half the universe. Tony by now knows why Stephen did what he did and he’s in awe of the sheer strength of character it took.

Also, Tony wants to scream at Stephen and ask him why he chose him. If it hadn’t been better if he’d done it himself. Or anyone else. Because this will haunt Tony for the rest of his days, not matter how it turned out in the end. But mostly he wants to see Stephen again.

At the Sanctum, Stephen is greeted by Wong but it’s a little bit understated, as is usual for them. Wong is honestly relieved and glad that Stephen’s back and there might even be a hug and a quietly spoken sentiment but Stephen can’t even deal with that right now. He shrugs off Wong’s concern and barricades himself in the bathroom for a long shower or something.

He doesn’t deserve concern and care. He just let half the universe die and it doesn’t matter that they’re all back now. Their return is on Tony Stark. Their death in the first place in on one Doctor Stephen Strange who once again broke his oath, no matter under which circumstances.

It’ll take a long, long time for Stephen to finally really accept his part in the whole Thanos fiasco.

When he finally comes back out (hours later? Maybe because the Cloak drags him out of there, because it’s worried?) there’s the full-sized, real-life version of Iron Man waiting for him in the chair beside his bed. Only, it’s not Iron Man it’s the man behind the mask. Tony, who has about a thousand other things to do right now but instead choose to track down one errant wizard to check if he’s okay (because he’s Tony Stark and he takes care of everyone, if they want him to or not). He just brought back half the population, they can go on without him for a while.

“Wong let me in,” he says in greeting and nods to the bed. “Sit down before you fall down. I was afraid you drowned yourself in there.”

Stephen is speechless, which hasn’t happened in a long time. But he sits down, expecting the same accusations he has tortured himself with since the moment he put the time stone into Thanos’ hand.

Instead he gets a quietly spoken but very heartfelt thank you for his sacrifices. He’s stunned, but finally finds it in him to quip back. Tony retaliates. It’s harmless back-and-forth and even a little bit of comfortable. Then they begin to talk in earnest and the fragile possibility of a friendship first seen on the Donut ship and Titan becomes a strong foundation for things to come.

💫

blog.name: perilous-marvel
blog.title: Marvel Stuff And Whatnot
blog.description: Two snowmen are in a garden. One says to the other, “Do you smell carrots?”

summary:
Steve: Alright, Tony, everyone is here. Why’d you assemble us?
Tony: That’s a great question, Steve-
Bucky whispering to Steve:...
body:
Steve: Alright, Tony, everyone is here. Why’d you assemble us?

Tony: That’s a great question, Steve-

Bucky whispering to Steve: Did he just call you by your real name?

Tony: Please, Barnes, save all questions until the end of the presentation.

Tony opening a slideshow: As you all know, being a hero is very dangerous but I’ve come up with a way to reward you! Introducing… drumroll please…

Dum-E: *trying to do a drumroll*

Tony: Stark Insurance! We have great rates and will even give you a free pen once you sign up! You will be rewarded for being safe and saving the planet-

Clint: You dragged me out of my nest for insurance?

Tony: Of course! It’s very important to get the right plan-

Clint lunging across the table: Arrgh-

Natasha: *holding him back*

Tony: Did you just ‘arrgh?’ Lucky for you, we cover pirates-

Natasha: *releases Clint*

Clint: Do you have lIFE INSURANCE, TONY? ‘CAUSE YOU’RE ABOUT TO NEED IT-

reblog.comment:

Tony opening a slideshow: As you all know, being a hero is very dangerous but I’ve come up with a way to reward you! Introducing… drumroll please…

Dum-E: *trying to do a drumroll*

Tony: Stark Insurance! We have great rates and will even give you a free pen once you sign up! You will be rewarded for being safe and saving the planet-

Clint: You dragged me out of my nest for insurance?

Tony: Of course! It’s very important to get the right plan-

Clint lunging across the table: Arrgh-

Natasha: *holding him back*

Tony: Did you just ‘arrgh?’ Lucky for you, we cover pirates-

Natasha: *releases Clint*

Clint: Do you have lIFE INSURANCE, TONY? ‘CAUSE YOU’RE ABOUT TO NEED IT-

trail.content_raw:
Steve: Alright, Tony, everyone is here. Why’d you assemble us?

Tony: That’s a great question, Steve-

Bucky whispering to Steve: Did he just call you by your real name?

Tony: Please, Barnes, save all questions until the end of the presentation.

Natasha: *holding him back*

Tony: Did you just ‘arrgh?’ Lucky for you, we cover pirates-

Natasha: *releases Clint*

Clint: Do you have lIFE INSURANCE, TONY? ‘CAUSE YOU’RE ABOUT TO NEED IT-

summary:
Avengers Head canon 
Whenever tony is sleep deprived any kind of baby proofing works on him too.
Just imagine how Rhodey found...
body:
Avengers Head canon

Whenever tony is sleep deprived any kind of baby proofing works on him too.

Just imagine how Rhodey found out, he is home with his mother inviting Tony to stay for what ever reason, and the house is baby proofed for someone

Tony just out from a designing binge (he can’t invent here but he can design) and just can’t get over the railing on the kitchen door XD

blog.name: myshittyironmansideblog

blog.description:

| 26 years old | trans guy | ben |
i only use the mobile app so im sorry if everything is a mess. 
my main blog is @icouldreallyuseanewurl

summary: are there any particular iron man comics you'd recommend for new readers?? im especially a fan of Intense Angst but anything...
question: are there any particular iron man comics you'd recommend for new readers?? im especially a fan of Intense Angst but anything that helps explain things for an uneducated person!! thanks sm and also i love ur blog
answer:
Thank you! ^_^

Everything I’m about to recommend is in the 616 universe (the main marvel universe).

1st and foremost on good, self contained, and angsty:

Extremis written by Warren Ellis!

It’s 6 issues. Iron Man (2004) #1 - #6

It’s a good cross section of the things that make iron man comics good. Tony struggles with identity and self-worth, and it is a self contained story.

After that:

The next 6 issues of Iron Man (2004) (#7 - #12)

It picks up right where extremis finished, so this one is not technically self contained. You gotta read extremis 1st, but it is worth it.

Extremis and Execute Program are the Iron Man comics that lead up to Civil War.

Next is Demon in a Bottle! Iron Man #120 to #128 (read all the issues in between). This is an important story arc for Tony, but you can read it without having read anything else.

Alright this next one is split up into 3 series:

Iron Age: Alpha

The Iron Age #1 - #3

Iron Age: Omega

The Iron Age is stand alone and completely self contained and so much fucking angst. I cried a lot while reading it lol. It’s really good right up til then end, but the end is kind of weak and rushed.

Iron Man: Fatal Frontier! It is 13 issues plus an annual at the very end. (Read the annual after you read the 13 issues of Fatal Frontier.)

You get to watch Tony slowly lose his mind and become kind of a monster. Also there are doomtony tentacles.

I personally think all of these are good at showing the kind of person tony is and the kind of person he can be when he gets caught up in his own ego.

I have some other post that have recommendations that I’ll reblog today for ya

title: Nyx
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TZS9DT

by voidthing1

“Her hand, for the first time in decades, shakes as she holds the bloody knife. From across the snow covered ground, he stares at her, fear and anger and amusement all swimming together. He knows what her decision will be. It’s him or her. It’s hardly a decision at all. With teeth bared like a wild animal, she lunges for him.”

Taegan Smith was nothing more than an average woman just trying to get through life.
Nyx, the Ghost, the Shadow, the White Viper was nothing more than a bloodthirsty assassin, a myth who striked fear into the heart of every woman and man.
Some days, she didn’t know which part of her was real: little Red Riding Hood or the Big Bad Wolf.

Words: 1393, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel, Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanoff, Clint Barton, Tony Stark, Bruce Banner, James Rhodes, Sam Wilson, Wanda Maximoff, Thor, Loki, Pietro Maximoff, Wade Wilson
  • Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Original Female Character(s), Clint Barton/Natasha Romanov, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Love, Friendship, Red Room, Pain, Torture, everyone makes an appearance - Freeform


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TZS9DT

title: Avengers: The Final Battle
body:

by Mitchellsfingerlessgloves
